title: PML-N to contest Haripur by-polls as a “united team”
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 14 (APP): The Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) will fully participate in the upcoming by-elections in Haripur, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, for constituency NA-18, being held on Nov 23, 2025.
Chairing a high-level party meeting, Federal Minister for Kashmir Affairs, Gilgit-Baltistan, and SAFRON, Engineer Amir Muqam, emphasized the party’s commitment to contesting the elections as a “united team.”
Muqam, who also serves as PML-N’s provincial president, highlighted the party’s legacy of public service, calling it a source of pride and vowing to make every effort to secure victory in the polls.
The meeting unveiled a comprehensive action plan for the by-elections, underscoring the party’s strategic approach and organizational readiness.
Prominent party figures in attendance included Captain (R) Safdar, Murtaza Javed Abbasi, Sardar Yousaf, former Chief Minister Pir Sabir Shah, and other senior PML-N leaders.
